column1: According to Stenzel (2013:1), "Wanano" is a name given by unknown outsiders and its use has been called into question by village leaders and the directors, teachers and students of the indigenous school. In 2006, the group publicly adopted the policy of using exclusively their own traditional name Kotiria 'water people' to refer to themselves and to their language and have requested that the outsiders working with them do the same.
The Wa'ikhana have adopted the policy of using the name "Wa'ikhana" rather than "Piratapuyo".
